bibl.title: Ferdinand Marino and Carolina B. Marino v. D. H. McCalla. Writ of Habeas Corpus and Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Northern Divison

div1.ab:
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, Ninth Judicial Circuit~~~District of Washington.
Northern DIVISION.

IN THE MATTER OF the petition of Ferdinand Marine and Carolina Beluscia Marino, on behalf of Joseph Marino,
On Habeas Corpus.
div1.p:
The President of the United States of America, To CAPTAIN D. H. McCALLA, Captain of the United States
Battleship "Wisconsin," or to any other person having custody of the said Joseph Marino,

Greeting:
You are Hereby Commanded, That you have the body of Joseph Marino, by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name he shall be called or charged, before the Honorable the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Ninth Judicial Circuit, District of Washington, at the Court-room of said Court, in the City of Seattle, Washington, on the 5th day of January 1903, 189 at 10 o'clock A.M., to do and receive what shall then be considered in the premises. And have you then and there this Writ.

Witness, the Honorable MELVILLE W. FULLER, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States, and the seal of said Circuit Court, this 31st day of December, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight Nine hundred and ninety two, and of our Independence the 127th.
div1.ab: United States of America, District of Washington
div1.p: I hereby certify and return that I served the annexed Writ of Habeas Corpus on the therein-named "person having the custody of the said Joseph Marino," namely H. J. Mayo, Commanding Officer of the U.S. Battleship "Wisconsin" by handing to and leaving a true and correct copy thereof with H. J. Mayo, Commanding Officer U.S. Battleship "Wisconsin" personally at Bremerton in said District on the 1st day of June., A. D. 1902
div1.ab: C. B. Hopkinas U. S. Marshal.
Circuit Court of the United States, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, Northern Division.
IN THE MATTER OF Ferdinant Marino et ON HABEAS CORPUS.
WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RETURN THERETO.
Filed on return, this 2nd day of January 189 1903
By H M Walthew Deputy Clerk.
